intro: Galeopsis dubia var. brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved hedge mustard, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its small, pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its seeds are dispersed by wind. This species is often considered a weed but has some ornamental value due to its delicate appearance.
